info.description: We encapsulate Radio & Music business logic for iPlayer Radio and BBC Music products on all platforms. We add value by reliably providing the right blend of metadata needed by clients.
info.title: Radio & Music Services

get.description: All broadcasts

parameters.description: Filter by Service ID. E.g. bbc_radio_fourfm
parameters.name: service_id

parameters.description: Sort by provided query. E.g. 'start_at' sorts in ascending order, and '-start_at' sorts in descending order
parameters.name: sort

401.description: There was an error with the supplied `Authorization` header.

get.description: Broadcasts for the current day

parameters.description: Filter by Service ID. E.g. bbc_radio_fourfm
parameters.name: service_id

parameters.description: Filter what is on air. E.g. 'now' returns current programme being broadcasted.
parameters.name: on_air

parameters.description: Filter what will be on air next in minutes. E.g. '240' returns programmes broadcasted in the next four hurs
parameters.name: next

parameters.description: Filter what was on air previously in minutes. E.g. '240' returns programmes broadcasted in the previous four hurs
parameters.name: previous

parameters.description: Sort by provided query. E.g. 'start_at' sorts in ascending order, and '-start_at' sorts in descending order
parameters.name: sort

get.description:
List of favourited episodes and clips for a given user for iPlayer Radio.

N.B.  Swagger schemas cannot currently handle multiple combinations of object in an array i.e. a mix of Episode
and Clip Summaries so we are defining data as a Programme Summary here.  This will be resolved in V3 with full support for
 anyOf https://www.openapis.org/blog/2017/01/24/a-new-year-a-new-specification

parameters.description: Sort order for Personalised Radio results
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Include items which have been 'soft' unfavourited in response. I.e items with UAS type of 'unfavourited'
parameters.name: show_all_activity

post.description:
Add User favourites

N.B. Any HTML tags submitted in metadata will be removed

put.description:
Update user favourites

N.B. Any HTML tags submitted in metadata will be removed

get.description:
List of followed 'clips' or 'episode' items for a given iPlayer Radio user

N.B.  Swagger schemas cannot currently handle multiple combinations of object in an array i.e. a mix of Episode
and Clip Summaries so we are defining data as a Programme Summary here.  This will be resolved in V3 with full support for
 anyOf https://www.openapis.org/blog/2017/01/24/a-new-year-a-new-specification

parameters.description: Supported Radio favourite types: Clips or Episodes
parameters.name: type

and Clip Summaries so we are defining data as a Programme Summary here.  This will be resolved in V3 with full support for
 anyOf https://www.openapis.org/blog/2017/01/24/a-new-year-a-new-specification

get.description:
Returns mixed episode and clip plays for a given BBC iPlayer radio user.

N.B.  Swagger schemas cannot currently handle multiple combinations of object in an array i.e. a mix of Episode
and Clip Summaries so we are defining data as a Programme Summary here.  This will be resolved in V3 with full support for
 anyOf https://www.openapis.org/blog/2017/01/24/a-new-year-a-new-specification

parameters.description: Sort order for Personalised Radio results
parameters.name: sort

Retrieve featured podcasts
Retrieve data about the podcast with the supplied PID
Retrieve all episodes for a specific podcast
All iPlayer Radio networks - contains business logic for masterbrand and service relationships

parameters.description: Returns all networks needed for iPlayer Radio responsive web navigation
parameters.name: preset

get.description: Retrieve Popular Episodes & Clips

parameters.description: Programme type required. Accepts comma separated values
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Filter by deduplication rule. E.g. 'tleo' returns programmes with distinct top level episode objects
parameters.name: distinct

parameters.description: Filter by network master brand ID (mid). Accepts comma separated values
parameters.name: network

parameters.description: Filter by network URL key. Accepts comma separated values
parameters.name: network_url_key

parameters.description: Filter by category. Accepts comma separated values
parameters.name: category

parameters.description: Filter by format. Accepts comma separated values
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: Filter by group. Accepts comma separated values
parameters.name: group

parameters.description: Filter by programme media type. Accepts comma separated values
parameters.name: media_type

parameters.description: Filter by container. Accepts any pid e.g. brand,series,episode
parameters.name: container

parameters.description: Filter by media set name. Accepts comma separated combinations of the following: pc,mobile-download,android-download-high,apple-ios-download-high,mobile-cellular-main,mobile-phone-main,iptv-all
parameters.name: media_set

get.description:
Provides a paginated list of programmes by PID (brand, series, episode and clip). Accepts various filters and sorting methods.

N.B.  Swagger schemas cannot currently handle multiple combinations of object in an array i.e. a mix of Episode
and Clip Summaries so we are defining results as an array of Programme Summary here.  This will be resolved in V3 with full support for
 anyOf https://www.openapis.org/blog/2017/01/24/a-new-year-a-new-specification

parameters.description: Filter by provided query. E.g. 'tleo' returns top level objects, ie. brands, orphaned series, and orphaned episodes
parameters.name: kind

parameters.description: Filter by network master brand ID (mid). Accepts comma separated values
parameters.name: network

parameters.description: Filter by network URL key. Accepts comma separated values
parameters.name: network_url_key

parameters.description: Filter by category id. Accepts comma separated values. See /category endpoint below for the type of response provided
parameters.name: category

parameters.description: Sort by provided query. E.g. 'title' sorts in ascending order, and -title sorts in descending order
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Filter by container. Accepts any brand or series pid
parameters.name: container

parameters.description: Filter by programme type. Accepts comma separated values
parameters.name: type

get.description:
Find programmes by PID (brand, series, episode and clip)

N.B.  Swagger schemas cannot currently handle multiple combinations of object in an array i.e. a mix of Episode
and Clip Summaries so we are defining results as an array of Programme Summary here.  This will be resolved in V3 with full support for
 anyOf https://www.openapis.org/blog/2017/01/24/a-new-year-a-new-specification

decomposed.description: In addition to the overall score, return a list of scores broken down by day N.B Must be used in conjunction with since and/or until and since is >= 31 days
decomposed.name: decomposed

network.description: Return items with given Network ID
network.name: network

rights.description: Only return available results for the web/mobile.
rights.name: rights

since.description: ISO 8601 Date yyyy-mm-dd.  Returns items between given time period and now
since.name: since

until.description: ISO 8601 Date yyyy-mm-dd.  Returns items between given 'since' and 'until' date params
until.name: until
